intro: Halogeton malacophyllus, commonly known as the sand mat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, aiding in survival in dry environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or yellowish in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert ecosystems. Halogeton malacophyllus is adapted to extreme heat and drought, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
